content:
er-Term Revenue Conversion (Weeks 9–12)
By the final third of the 90-day plan, the goal is to convert pipeline opportunities into signed
agreements:
• Secure at least one formal design facilitation or grant consulting agreement tied to a
refuge-capable building project.
• Negotiate distribution or licensing terms for the convertible pew design with at least one
manufacturer.
• Pursue at least one government or philanthropic grant application where Northstar is paid
for preparing and submitting the package.
• Document all projects in a portfolio format for marketing to additional prospects.
4. Financial Targets & Cash Flow Goals

The following are conservative targets for the 90-day window:
• $10,000–$20,000 from consulting/facilitation fees (scope-of-work, grant facilitation).
• $5,000–$15,000 from manufacturer referral commissions or design licensing.
• $25,000+ in pending receivables from signed contracts initiated during the 90-day
window.
• Pipeline value of $250,000+ in prospective projects where Northstar is positioned for a
share of revenue.
5. Key Risks & Mitigations
• Risk: Delay in securing a signed contract – Mitigation: Diversify prospects, keep active
contact with multiple contractors and manufacturers.
• Risk: Grant eligibility or timing issues – Mitigation: Identify multiple funding streams and
stay flexible in matching them to projects.
• Risk: Over-reliance on one project (RTS Chapel) – Mitigation: Use RTS concept as a model,
not a dependency.
